item.title: git clone fails with fatal: Unable to find remote helper for 'https'
item.description: I've been working in a client site without Internet connection, and behind a troll proxy. There is an internal yum repository, but many dependencies are missing. There weren't git-all, git or git-core packages there, so I had to download and install from sources. I didn't pay attention to the ./configure output and proceeded with make and make install. Git was installed and ready to rock, but in my first git clone https:// (SSH ports are blocked) I received: fatal: Unable to find remote helper for 'https'.
